question.title: adding items to a JPanel with a button
question.body:
I've been trying to create a program that tracks a shopping list and adds new JLabels whenever the corresponding buttons are pressed, but for some reason whenever I press the button nothing new comes up

import java.awt.EventQueue;

import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JPanel;
import javax.swing.border.EmptyBorder;
import javax.swing.GroupLayout;
import javax.swing.GroupLayout.Alignment;
import javax.swing.JLabel;
import java.awt.Font;
import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.LayoutStyle.ComponentPlacement;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;
import javax.swing.JTextField;
import java.awt.Point;
import javax.swing.SwingConstants;
import java.awt.GridLayout;
import javax.swing.SpringLayout;
import java.awt.GridBagLayout;
import java.awt.GridBagConstraints;

public class shoppingJframe extends JFrame {

    private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
    public int totalitemNum = 0;
    public int buttonGap = 18 + (30 * totalitemNum);

    /**
     * Launch the application.
     */
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        EventQueue.invokeLater(new Runnable() {
            public void run() {
                try {
                    shoppingJframe frame = new shoppingJframe();
                    frame.setVisible(true);
                } catch (Exception e) {
                    e.printStackTrace();
                }
            }
        });
    }

    /**
     * Create the frame.
     */
    public shoppingJframe() {
        setTitle("Shopping Cart");
        setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
        setBounds(100, 100, 592, 568);
        JPanel contentPane = new JPanel();
        contentPane.setBorder(new EmptyBorder(5, 5, 5, 5));

        setContentPane(contentPane);
        
        JPanel itemPanel = new JPanel();
        
        JLabel CartLbl = new JLabel("Shopping Cart: ");
        CartLbl.setFont(new Font("Tahoma", Font.PLAIN, 14));
        
        
        
        JLabel Item1Lbl = new JLabel("Item 1 - $10.0");
        Item1Lbl.setFont(new Font("Tahoma", Font.PLAIN, 14));
        Item1Lbl.setSize(40,30);
        
        
        
        JLabel Item2Lbl = new JLabel("Item 2 - $20.0");
        Item2Lbl.setFont(new Font("Tahoma", Font.PLAIN, 14));
        Item2Lbl.setSize(40,30);
        
        
        JLabel Item3Lbl = new JLabel("Item 3 - $30.0");
        Item3Lbl.setFont(new Font("Tahoma", Font.PLAIN, 14));
        Item3Lbl.setSize(40,30);
        
        
        JButton Item1Btn = new JButton("Add Item 1 to Cart");
        Item1Btn.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                
                
                totalitemNum++;
                
                itemPanel.add(Item1Lbl);
                CartLbl.setText("Shopping Cart (" + totalitemNum + " items):");
                contentPane.revalidate();
                itemPanel.revalidate();
                
            }
        });
        Item1Btn.setFont(new Font("Tahoma", Font.PLAIN, 14));
        
        JButton Item2Btn = new JButton("Add Item 2 To Cart");
        Item2Btn.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                
                
                totalitemNum++;
                
                itemPanel.add(Item2Lbl);
                CartLbl.setText("Shopping Cart (" + totalitemNum + " items):");
                contentPane.revalidate();
                itemPanel.revalidate();
                
            }
        });
        Item2Btn.setFont(new Font("Tahoma", Font.PLAIN, 14));
        
        JButton Item3Btn = new JButton("Add Item 3 To Cart");
        Item3Btn.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                
                
                totalitemNum++;
                
                itemPanel.add(Item3Lbl);
                CartLbl.setText("Shopping Cart (" + totalitemNum + " items):");
                contentPane.revalidate();
                itemPanel.revalidate();
                
            }
        });
        Item3Btn.setFont(new Font("Tahoma", Font.PLAIN, 14));
        
        
        GroupLayout gl_contentPane = new GroupLayout(contentPane);
        gl_contentPane.setHorizontalGroup(
            gl_contentPane.createParallelGroup(Alignment.LEADING)
                .addGroup(gl_contentPane.createSequentialGroup()
                    .addGap(32)
                    .addGroup(gl_contentPane.createParallelGroup(Alignment.LEADING, false)
                        .addComponent(Item1Btn, GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, Short.MAX_VALUE)
                        .addComponent(CartLbl, GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, 117, Short.MAX_VALUE)
                        .addComponent(Item2Btn, GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, 169, Short.MAX_VALUE)
                        .addComponent(Item3Btn, GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, Short.MAX_VALUE))
                    .addPreferredGap(ComponentPlacement.RELATED)
                    .addComponent(itemPanel, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE, 247, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE)
                    .addContainerGap(114, Short.MAX_VALUE))
        );
        gl_contentPane.setVerticalGroup(
            gl_contentPane.createParallelGroup(Alignment.LEADING)
                .addGroup(gl_contentPane.createSequentialGroup()
                    .addGap(27)
                    .addGroup(gl_contentPane.createParallelGroup(Alignment.LEADING)
                        .addComponent(itemPanel, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE, 459, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE)
                        .addGroup(gl_contentPane.createSequentialGroup()
                            .addComponent(CartLbl, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE, 41, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE)
                            .addGap(buttonGap)
                            .addComponent(Item1Btn, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE, 29, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE)
                            .addGap(18)
                            .addComponent(Item2Btn, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE, 29, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE)
                            .addGap(18)
                            .addComponent(Item3Btn, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE, 29, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE)))
                    .addContainerGap(35, Short.MAX_VALUE))
        );
        GroupLayout gl_itemPanel = new GroupLayout(itemPanel);
        gl_itemPanel.setHorizontalGroup(
            gl_itemPanel.createParallelGroup(Alignment.LEADING)
                .addGap(0, 247, Short.MAX_VALUE)
        );
        gl_itemPanel.setVerticalGroup(
            gl_itemPanel.createParallelGroup(Alignment.LEADING)
                .addGap(0, 459, Short.MAX_VALUE)
        );
        itemPanel.setLayout(gl_itemPanel);
        contentPane.setLayout(gl_contentPane);
    }
}

im honestly not even sure where to start trying to fix the issue, ive just been staring at my compiler for what feels like ages tryng to make sense of the issue.

answers.body:
Since itemPanel (in the code in your question) is using GroupLayout, you cannot simply add a component.

I have partially fixed your code such that it displays the JLabels when clicking the JButtons but each JLabel is only added once, no matter how many times you click the JButtons and I don't think that is your intention. The below code is based on the answer to this question.

import java.awt.EventQueue;

import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JPanel;
import javax.swing.border.EmptyBorder;
import javax.swing.GroupLayout;
import javax.swing.GroupLayout.Alignment;
import javax.swing.JLabel;
import java.awt.Font;
import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.LayoutStyle.ComponentPlacement;
import java.awt.event.ActionListener;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;

public class shoppingJframe extends JFrame {
    private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
    private GroupLayout.ParallelGroup glpg;
    private GroupLayout.SequentialGroup glsg;
    public int totalitemNum = 0;
    public int buttonGap = 18 + (30 * totalitemNum);

    /**
     * Launch the application.
     */
    public static void main(String[] args) {
        EventQueue.invokeLater(new Runnable() {
            public void run() {
                try {
                    shoppingJframe frame = new shoppingJframe();
                    frame.setVisible(true);
                } catch (Exception e) {
                    e.printStackTrace();
                }
            }
        });
    }

    /**
     * Create the frame.
     */
    public shoppingJframe() {
        setTitle("Shopping Cart");
        setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
        setBounds(100, 100, 592, 568);
        JPanel contentPane = new JPanel();
        contentPane.setBorder(new EmptyBorder(5, 5, 5, 5));
        setContentPane(contentPane);
        JPanel itemPanel = new JPanel();
        JLabel CartLbl = new JLabel("Shopping Cart: ");
        CartLbl.setFont(new Font("Tahoma", Font.PLAIN, 14));
        JLabel Item1Lbl = new JLabel("Item 1 - $10.0");
        Item1Lbl.setFont(new Font("Tahoma", Font.PLAIN, 14));
        JLabel Item2Lbl = new JLabel("Item 2 - $20.0");
        Item2Lbl.setFont(new Font("Tahoma", Font.PLAIN, 14));
        JLabel Item3Lbl = new JLabel("Item 3 - $30.0");
        Item3Lbl.setFont(new Font("Tahoma", Font.PLAIN, 14));
        Item3Lbl.setSize(40,30);
        JButton Item1Btn = new JButton("Add Item 1 to Cart");
        Item1Btn.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                totalitemNum++;
                GroupLayout grpLayout = (GroupLayout) itemPanel.getLayout();
                glpg.addGroup(grpLayout.createSequentialGroup().addComponent(Item1Lbl));
                glsg.addGroup(grpLayout.createParallelGroup(GroupLayout.Alignment.LEADING)
                    .addComponent(Item1Lbl));
                CartLbl.setText("Shopping Cart (" + totalitemNum + " items):");
            }
        });
        Item1Btn.setFont(new Font("Tahoma", Font.PLAIN, 14));
        JButton Item2Btn = new JButton("Add Item 2 To Cart");
        Item2Btn.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                totalitemNum++;
                GroupLayout grpLayout = (GroupLayout) itemPanel.getLayout();
                glpg.addGroup(grpLayout.createSequentialGroup().addComponent(Item2Lbl));
                glsg.addGroup(grpLayout.createParallelGroup(GroupLayout.Alignment.LEADING)
                    .addComponent(Item2Lbl));
                CartLbl.setText("Shopping Cart (" + totalitemNum + " items):");
            }
        });
        Item2Btn.setFont(new Font("Tahoma", Font.PLAIN, 14));
        JButton Item3Btn = new JButton("Add Item 3 To Cart");
        Item3Btn.addActionListener(new ActionListener() {
            public void actionPerformed(ActionEvent e) {
                totalitemNum++;
                GroupLayout grpLayout = (GroupLayout) itemPanel.getLayout();
                glpg.addGroup(grpLayout.createSequentialGroup().addComponent(Item3Lbl));
                glsg.addGroup(grpLayout.createParallelGroup(GroupLayout.Alignment.LEADING)
                    .addComponent(Item3Lbl));
                CartLbl.setText("Shopping Cart (" + totalitemNum + " items):");
            }
        });
        Item3Btn.setFont(new Font("Tahoma", Font.PLAIN, 14));
        GroupLayout gl_contentPane = new GroupLayout(contentPane);
        gl_contentPane.setHorizontalGroup(
            gl_contentPane.createParallelGroup(Alignment.LEADING)
                .addGroup(gl_contentPane.createSequentialGroup()
                    .addGap(32)
                    .addGroup(gl_contentPane.createParallelGroup(Alignment.LEADING, false)
                        .addComponent(Item1Btn, GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, Short.MAX_VALUE)
                        .addComponent(CartLbl, GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, 117, Short.MAX_VALUE)
                        .addComponent(Item2Btn, GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, 169, Short.MAX_VALUE)
                        .addComponent(Item3Btn, GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, GroupLayout.DEFAULT_SIZE, Short.MAX_VALUE))
                    .addPreferredGap(ComponentPlacement.RELATED)
                    .addComponent(itemPanel, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE, 247, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE)
                    .addContainerGap(114, Short.MAX_VALUE))
        );
        gl_contentPane.setVerticalGroup(
            gl_contentPane.createParallelGroup(Alignment.LEADING)
                .addGroup(gl_contentPane.createSequentialGroup()
                    .addGap(27)
                    .addGroup(gl_contentPane.createParallelGroup(Alignment.LEADING)
                        .addComponent(itemPanel, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE, 459, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE)
                        .addGroup(gl_contentPane.createSequentialGroup()
                            .addComponent(CartLbl, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE, 41, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE)
                            .addGap(buttonGap)
                            .addComponent(Item1Btn, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE, 29, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE)
                            .addGap(18)
                            .addComponent(Item2Btn, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE, 29, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE)
                            .addGap(18)
                            .addComponent(Item3Btn, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE, 29, GroupLayout.PREFERRED_SIZE)))
                    .addContainerGap(35, Short.MAX_VALUE))
        );
        GroupLayout gl_itemPanel = new GroupLayout(itemPanel);
        glpg = gl_itemPanel.createParallelGroup(Alignment.LEADING);
        glsg = gl_itemPanel.createSequentialGroup();
        gl_itemPanel.setVerticalGroup(glsg);
        gl_itemPanel.setHorizontalGroup(glpg);
        itemPanel.setLayout(gl_itemPanel);
        contentPane.setLayout(gl_contentPane);
    }
}

Here is a screen capture:

I assume that your code uses GroupLayout because you used the GUI builder of your IDE. I have been coding Swing applications for many years and I never use a GUI builder. I draw the design on paper and then I write the code. Therefore, I recommend that you re-design your GUI. Rather than using JLabels, use a JList. Consider the following code.
(Uses method references and switch expressions.)

import java.awt.BorderLayout;
import java.awt.Color;
import java.awt.EventQueue;
import java.awt.FlowLayout;
import java.awt.GridLayout;
import java.awt.event.ActionEvent;

import javax.swing.BorderFactory;
import javax.swing.DefaultListModel;
import javax.swing.JButton;
import javax.swing.JFrame;
import javax.swing.JLabel;
import javax.swing.JList;
import javax.swing.JPanel;
import javax.swing.JScrollPane;

public class Shopping implements Runnable {
    private static final String  ONE = "ONE";
    private static final String  TWO = "TWO";
    private static final String  THREE = "THREE";
    private static final String  ITEM_1 = "Item 1 - $10.00";
    private static final String  ITEM_2 = "Item 2 - $20.00";
    private static final String  ITEM_3 = "Item 3 - $30.00";

    private int  totalItems;
    private JFrame  frame;
    private JLabel  cartLabel;
    private JList<String>  list;

    public void run() {
        createAndDisplayGui();
    }

    private void addItem(ActionEvent event) {
        DefaultListModel<String> model = (DefaultListModel<String>) list.getModel();
        String element = switch (event.getActionCommand()) {
            case ONE -> ITEM_1;
            case TWO -> ITEM_2;
            case THREE -> ITEM_3;
            default -> "Unhandled";
        };
        model.addElement(element);
        totalItems++;
        cartLabel.setText(getCartLabelText());
    }

    private void createAndDisplayGui() {
        frame = new JFrame("Shopping Cart");
        frame.setDefaultCloseOperation(JFrame.EXIT_ON_CLOSE);
        frame.add(createTotal(), BorderLayout.PAGE_START);
        frame.add(createList(), BorderLayout.CENTER);
        frame.add(createButtons(), BorderLayout.LINE_START);
        frame.pack();
        frame.setLocationByPlatform(true);
        frame.setVisible(true);
    }
    private JButton createButton(String text, String actionCommand) {
        JButton button = new JButton(text);
        button.setActionCommand(actionCommand);
        button.addActionListener(this::addItem);
        return button;
    }

    private JPanel createButtons() {
        JPanel panel = new JPanel(new GridLayout(0, 1, 0, 10));
        panel.setBorder(BorderFactory.createEmptyBorder(10, 10, 10, 10));
        panel.add(createButton("Add Item 1 to Cart", ONE));
        panel.add(createButton("Add Item 2 to Cart", TWO));
        panel.add(createButton("Add Item 3 to Cart", THREE));
        return panel;
    }

    private JScrollPane createList() {
        list = new JList<>(new DefaultListModel<>());
        JScrollPane scrollPane = new JScrollPane(list);
        scrollPane.setBorder(BorderFactory.createCompoundBorder(BorderFactory.createEmptyBorder(10, 0, 10, 10),
                                                                BorderFactory.createLineBorder(Color.black)));
        return scrollPane;
    }

    private JPanel createTotal() {
        JPanel panel = new JPanel(new FlowLayout(FlowLayout.LEADING));
        cartLabel = new JLabel(getCartLabelText());
        panel.add(cartLabel);
        return panel;
    }

    private String getCartLabelText() {
        return String.format("Shopping Cart (%d items):", totalItems);
    }

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        EventQueue.invokeLater(new Shopping());
    }
}

Here is a screen capture:

question_comments.body: Use a different layout manager, or combination of layout managers. Maybe a vertical BoxLayout. Read the tutorial and understand how each layout manager works.
I switched to flow layout however now im unable to move everything to the positions it's supposed to be, and the items are coming from left to right instead of top to bottom, how do i fix that?

Also: 1) Class names should start with a upper case character. Variable names should NOT start with an upper case character. Learn and follow Java naming conventions. 2) Fon't objects can be shared by multiple components. There is no need to create a new instance for each component. 3) Don't use setSize(...). It is the job of the layout manager to set the size/location of components.

Don't use a GroupLayout. The GroupLayout is the most complicated layout manager. Your "itemPanel" uses a GroupLayout, but you don't specify any constraints when you add the component to the panel, so you don't see the component. Try just using the default FlowLayout of the panel to see if you get a difference. If you really want to use the GroupLayout, then you need to specify constraints every time you add a component. Read the tutorial on Using a GroupLayout
